definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: And I have seen the eternal Footman hold my coat, and snicker.
sentences.chinese: 我曾眼見永恆的守門人接過我的大衣，然後竊笑。

sentences.english: Dick told the door keeper to dig a deep hole in the dark muddy garden.
sentences.chinese: 迪克要守門人在花園裏的黑泥中挖一個深洞。

sentences.english: Why they regard the giraffe as the "doorkeeper" of the company?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼將長頸鹿作爲公司的“守門人”？

sentences.english: The doorkeeper gave the alarm as soon as he saw the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 守門人一看見冒煙就發出警報。

sentences.english: We are now declared free from the tyranny of The Gatekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們宣佈要掙脫“守門人”的專制。

sentences.english: I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of lord than dwell in the tents of wickedness.
sentences.chinese: 我與其住在罪孽的天幕中，還不如做神殿的守門人。

sentences.english: As he was walking to the station, he noticed one of his night watchmen.
sentences.chinese: 在他走去火車站的時，他看到一個夜間守門人。

sentences.english: If the brain has a gatekeeper of sensory information, the hippocampus is it .
sentences.chinese: 如果腦部對感覺訊息有個守門人，則非海馬迴莫屬。

definition: benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to accompany/(of a doctor etc) to do a follow-up (on a patient, client etc)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
